sect1.title: What's Covered Here?

note.title: Prerequisites for this Guide
note.para: This section assumes you have completed the section: &susemgr; &productnumber3; Installation as an Extension

sect1.para: This chapter finalizes &susemgr; setup. You will perform the following procedures:

listitem.para: Use a terminal to initiate &susemgr; setup
Create the admin user with the &susemgr; WebGUI
Connect with &scc; and select channels appropriate for your clients media and software sources

sect1.title: &susemgr; Setup Procedure

procedure.title: &susemgr; Setup
procedure.para: This section will guide you through &susemgr; setup procedures.

step.para: To begin login to the &sle; 12 desktop. Open a terminal and as root and type: yast2 susemanager_setup then press enter to initiate setup.
On the initial screen select Set up SUSE Manager from scratch and then select Next to continue.

Enter an email address which will receive notifications about the servers status. The number of emails sent from Manager can be extensive, therefore notifications via email may be disabled from the webGUI after setup if desired. Select Next to continue.

Enter your Certificate information and a password. The password should be stored in a secure location. Without this password it will not be possible to setup a &susemgr; Proxy Server. Select Next to proceed.
You will be using an Embedded Database for this guide. Enter a database user and password. This password should be stored in a secure location. Select Next to continue.

&susemgr; requires that you connect to &scc; for software, updates and patches. You will be unable to synchronize or provide channels to your clients without this information. Enter your &scc; Organization Credentials. You may register or Login for access to your organization credentials. Select Next to continue.
Select Yes to run setup when prompted. When completed you will be presented with your new &susemgr; webGUI address. Select Finish to complete &susemgr; setup.

sect1.para: In the next section you will create the administrator account and synchronize with &scc;.

sect1.title: Creating the &susemgr; Administrator Account
sect1.para: This section will walk you through creating the administrator account for your &susemgr; Server. This is the highest authority account within &susemgr; and therefore administrator account access information should be stored in a secure location. It is recommended that an administrator creates low level user accounts designated for administration of each organization or group under the administrator account for security.
